did.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee Dept. of Social Work Records,1982-2012

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. Dept. of Social Work

physdesc.label: Quantity
physdesc.extent: plus additions of 1.4 cubic ft. (2 boxes)

extref.corpname: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Libraries, Archives Department

did.abstract: The collection contains syllabi files from the Department of Social Work, dating from 1982 to 2012. The Department, which is one of two in the Helen Bader School of Social Welfare, maintained these central files of course syllabi per the UW-Milwaukee Uniform Syllabus Policy. The syllabi include information on departmental policies, course schedules, course readings, and information on teaching faculty. Accession 2015-017 include additions of restricted executive committee meeting minutes, dating from 1995 to 2000. The records include decisions made on tenure and promotion, and other sensitive matters pertaining to the department (1.4 cubic ft., 2 boxes).

bioghist.p: In 1956, when the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee was established, the Department of Social Work was created, and administered within the College of Letters & Science. In April 1963, the School of Social Work was established, headed by a director, and remained part of the College of Letters & Science. In 1965, the School changed its name to the School of Social Welfare and became an independent, dean-headed school. The School of Social Welfare during this period maintained a curriculum similar to that of the modern Department of Social Work, although in 1968 a program in Criminal Justice was added to the school's offerings. In 2002, the faculty of the School of Social Welfare voted to departmentalize the school into a Department of Criminal Justice and a Department of Social Work, citing the need for both programs to focus on their particular specialities. The split was approved by the Faculty Senate and the two departments split in Spring 2003.

scopecontent.p: The majority of the collection contains course syllabi from courses offered by the Department from 1982-2012. Accession 2015-017 includes restricted executive committee meeting minutes from 1995 to 2000.

arrangement.p: The syllabi files are organized by course number, then chronologically. Accession 2015-017 is organized by subject, then chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material in the UWM Libraries

archref.unittitle: UW-Milwaukee School of Social Welfare, Office of the Dean Records
UW-Milwaukee School of Social Welfare, Office of the Associate Dean Records

accessrestrict.p: The executive committee records (accession 2015-017) are restricted in accordance with UWM Personnel File Policy S-42. Access is regulated by Section III.A.2 and III.A.3. There are no access restrictions on the rest of the collection, which is open to all members of the public in accordance with state law.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of libel, privacy, and copyright which may be involved in the use of this collection (Wisconsin Statutes 19.21-19.39).

acqinfo.p: The Department of Social Work donated the materials in ??? (orig. 4 boxes). The syllabi files were transferred to the Archives in 2012 and 2014 (accessions 2012-047 and 2014-018). The executive committee records (accession 2015-2017) were donated in 2015. NOT DONE.

processinfo.p: ??? processed the original collection in ??? (original 4 boxes). Brad Houston minimally processed accession 2015-017. Phyllis Reske minimally processed accessions 2012-047 and 2014-018 in December 2016 and created a finding aid for the collection in January 2017 (Brad Houston supervised).NOT DONE
